intro: Bicorona philliraeoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sun-cup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in a disk-like structure surrounded by bracts, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Bicorona philliraeoides is often found in coastal and inland areas, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
